posts.name: Nathan Zhou
posts.cooked:
Update: Demo video

To elaborate on thisâ€¦

R707 RFID Update - Did anyone use it? Electrical

Let me share some progress.

Done: Android APP, RFID tag data format, ESP32 reader driver, roboRIO library, CAN communication, Working in progress: ESP32 bugfix,

What is logged on battery tag:

Serial Number

Cycle Count

Status notes (0 = normal, 1 = practice, 3 = Scrap, 4 = Other)

Detailed usage log (up to 14 entry) with date time, lowest voltage recorded and energy used.

The goal of this project is to have a ESP32 driving two RC522 reader connected onto the robot using CAN . The RFID tag I am using is Mifare Classic 1K which most RC522 module purchase come with and can be cheaply acquired. Data stored on Mifare card are NDEF formatted json ( documentation of the json format ).

Every time the battery is inserted to robot, a new usage record will be created on battery tag. This can be used with or without code deployment on roborio as some of the feature rely on roboRIO CAN heartbeat . If library  code is not deployed, the only information could be logged onto the battery is â€˜the battery is usedâ€™. If library code is loaded onto roboRIO, lowest voltage during operation and energy used can also be logged. Also library is needed for retrieving data from battery.

Based on the size of Mifare card, a total of 14 record can be saved on battery. Newer record will flush the oldest record.

There will be an android application, which is used to initialize (set serial number) and write to tag (for example, set notes and label battery as charged). Most importantly this app act as the viewer of battery information. Every time a battery is interrogated with this phone, it log everything on that battery tag for future analysis.

The android application is pretty much complete.

GitHub - sikaxn/FRC-RFID-Battery-Reader Contribute to sikaxn/FRC-RFID-Battery-Reader development by creating an account on GitHub.

posts.name: Ada T
posts.cooked: Is there a record on the battery of total number of cycles and total discharged energy that doesnâ€™t get cleared?

posts.name: Nathan Zhou
posts.cooked:
Yes. As long as you donâ€™t initialize the (tag you are using ) tag using the app.

Cycle count only increment when charger log is added.

See screenshot of the android app.

posts.name: Nathan Zhou
posts.cooked: Correction: only cycles. Total discharge energy will not be Recorded. However, this can be obtained by pulling log from Android app and do some data analysis. Assume no log is lost.

posts.name: Nathan Zhou
posts.cooked:
a progress update: roboRIO driver is mostly completed.

Contribute to sikaxn/FRC-Custom-CAN-Sensor development by creating an account on GitHub.

roboRIO now can read battery information and send data to arduino.

Something i figure out is the documentation of FRC Can Spec say time and date is included in heartbeat. however decode towards those field turns out to be match time countdown.

therefore I needs to have my roboRIO driver send datetime, voltage and energy to ESP32.

I am still working on write logic in ESP32. I want this process to be handled automatically. Here is my plan:

When ESP32 power up, it will scan on both reader (I have 2 reader attached assuming a battery can be installed in any direction), once a card is found, it will lock on with that reader.

once a reader is chosen, it will pull data from battery and send it to CAN .

A new usage record is created with voltage, date, etc all 0 because at this time roboRIO isnâ€™t fully booted yet.

once a meaningful date message (roboRIO get its date time after attaching to DS ) is received from roboRIO, it will update the date on that record

robot start being driven, tested, etc. ESP32 monitor voltage sent from roboRIO and record the lowest value

robot is disabled. disable will trigger a write. Latest date time, voltage energy is written to battery

robot is re enabledâ€¦ and disabled. every time robot is disabled, that record is updated.

we are done with robot, battery removed from robot, and data could be pulled by android APP.

posts.name: Nathan Zhou
posts.cooked: so i posted a demo video on top of the thread. Itâ€™s mostly working now.

posts.name: Nathan Zhou
posts.cooked:
So I donâ€™t know the proper way of doing this and I am asking for opinions.

Basically what I am trying to do is have my ESP32 automatically discover power distribution device ( CTRE PDP 1.0 or REV PDH ) on CAN bus, read total current and battery voltage from it which will then be used for logging into the battery. Currently, I figured it out the protocol from WPILIB source code and I am able to automatically discover PD and read data.

Now the tricky part: how to calculate energy for REV PDH . Unlike CTRE PDP which metre energy by itself give you energy reading over CAN message, PDH donâ€™t have such feature thus require custom implementation on the micro controller.

These are some of the problems.

CAN is asynchronous. However timeframe for voltage and current data needs to be aligned.

Energy = âˆ« P(t) dt = âˆ« V(t) Ã— I(t) dt. Time is an important factor. What sample should be used and how sampling should be handled. Especially if there is a lot of voltage and current spike in FRC use.

How to handle lost CAN communication, PD malfunction, etc.

One restriction with this is our micro controller cannot send any command to PDP or PDH (for example, clear, sticky fault). All it can do is passively listening CAN messages.

I am a little bit lost so I am asking for advice. Once this is done, battery log could be done without any code deployment on roboRIO (unless you want to read the data from roboRIO or CTRE PDP 2.0 is used because of no CAN support which require fallback voltage reading from roboRIO) as timestamp are read from heartbeat and power data is read from PD.

posts.name: Nathan Zhou
posts.cooked:
This will be the last update to battery tracking unless a significant bug is found until next season.

Contribute to sikaxn/FRC-Custom-CAN-Sensor development by creating an account on GitHub.

In this version, power distribution device ( CTRE PDP 1.0 or REV PDH ) on CAN bus will be automatically discovered. This means, no code in roboRIO is needed if you donâ€™t need to read battery data on roboRIO. However this do require your PD connected to CAN . If PD can not be connected to CAN or CTRE PDP 2.0 is used, roboRIO code is needed to write lowest voltage to battery and energy will not be accounted.

This version will calculate total energy using voltage and current in 100ms sample rate using a dedicated task. However the way i impliment it is still pretty rough.

Date time is now pulled from roboRIO heartbeat thanks to @Thad_House reminder on CAN message bits. All date time is saved in UTC in rfid tag and displayed on android app as local time.

If anyone have suggestions or find bugs, please do not hesitate to reply in this thread! Itâ€™s been a lot of learning in this project!
